sourcesContent:
/**
 * Medical Conditions Data
 * Contains information about various infectious diseases and their treatment protocols
 * This data is used throughout the application for displaying condition details
 */

const medicalConditions = [
  {
    id: 'bloodstream_infection',
    category: 'Bloodstream',
    name: 'Uncomplicated Bloodstream Infection',
    commonPathogens: ['S. aureus (MSSA/MRSA)', 'Enterococcus faecalis', 'E. coli', 'Pseudomonas aeruginosa'],
    empiricTherapy: {
      'MSSA': 'Cefazolin OR Oxacillin OR Nafcillin',
      'MRSA': 'Vancomycin OR Linezolid OR Daptomycin',
      'Enterococcus': 'Ampicillin (E. faecalis) OR Vancomycin (E. faecium)',
      'Gram-negative': 'Based on susceptibility testing'
    },
    duration: '14 days from first negative blood culture (S. aureus), 7 days (Enterococcus, Gram-negatives)',
    keyPoints: [
      'Defined as ≤3 days bacteremia in non-neutropenic host',
      'No complex source (endocarditis, osteomyelitis)',
      'Vascular catheter removal recommended for persistent bacteremia',
      'Duration based on active therapy regardless of catheter removal'
    ],
    clinicalPearls: [
      'Early transition to oral antibiotics possible for uncomplicated gram-negative bacteremia',
      'Monitor for source control and hemodynamic stability',
      'Consider MRSA risk factors and local prevalence'
    ]
  },
  {
    id: 'osteomyelitis',
    category: 'Bone/Joint',
    name: 'Acute Hematogenous Osteomyelitis',
    commonPathogens: ['S. aureus', 'Streptococcus pyogenes', 'Kingella kingae'],
    empiricTherapy: {
      'Mild-Moderate': 'Cefazolin OR Oxacillin OR Nafcillin',
      'Severe (Low MRSA)': 'Cefazolin OR Oxacillin OR Nafcillin',
      'Severe (High MRSA)': 'Vancomycin'
    },
    duration: '3-4 weeks',
    keyPoints: [
      'Kingella not effectively treated by clindamycin',
      'Early switch to oral route recommended with clinical improvement',
      'Chronic osteomyelitis requires more prolonged treatment'
    ],
    clinicalPearls: [
      'Consider combination therapy (vancomycin + oxacillin) for severe sepsis',
      'MRI is gold standard for diagnosis',
      'Blood cultures positive in 50-60% of cases'
    ]
  },
  {
    id: 'meningitis',
    category: 'CNS',
    name: 'Bacterial Meningitis (Non-neonates)',
    commonPathogens: ['S. pneumoniae', 'N. meningitidis', 'H. influenzae'],
    empiricTherapy: {
      'Empiric Treatment': 'Ceftriaxone PLUS Vancomycin'
    },
    duration: 'S. pneumoniae: 10-14 days, H. influenzae: 7-10 days, N. meningitidis: 5-7 days',
    keyPoints: [
      'Vancomycin added for possible resistant S. pneumoniae',
      'Dexamethasone beneficial for H. influenzae meningitis',
      'Consider acyclovir for concurrent encephalitis',
      'Longer courses needed for parenchymal brain infection'
    ],
    clinicalPearls: [
      'Lumbar puncture before antibiotics when possible',
      'Blood cultures positive in 50-80% of cases',
      'Steroid therapy reduces hearing loss in Hib meningitis'
    ]
  },
  {
    id: 'pneumonia',
    category: 'Respiratory',
    name: 'Community-Acquired Pneumonia',
    commonPathogens: ['S. pneumoniae', 'Mycoplasma pneumoniae', 'S. pyogenes', 'S. aureus', 'Respiratory viruses'],
    empiricTherapy: {
      'Outpatient': 'Amoxicillin OR Ampicillin OR Penicillin',
      'Inpatient': 'Ceftriaxone (high PCN-resistant regions)',
      'Atypical Coverage': 'Add macrolide if Mycoplasma suspected',
      'MRSA Coverage': 'Add Vancomycin OR Clindamycin if suspected'
    },
    duration: '5 days for uncomplicated CAP with resolution of fever/tachypnea',
    keyPoints: [
      'Respiratory viruses cause majority of CAP in young children',
      'Early switch to oral route encouraged',
      'Transient S. pneumoniae bacteremia doesn\'t warrant prolonged IV therapy'
    ],
    clinicalPearls: [
      'Consider S. aureus superinfection with influenza',
      'Atypical pathogens more common in school-age children',
      'Pleural effusion may complicate treatment'
    ]
  },
  {
    id: 'cellulitis',
    category: 'Skin/Soft Tissue',
    name: 'Cellulitis (Non-purulent)',
    commonPathogens: ['S. pyogenes', 'S. aureus'],
    empiricTherapy: {
      'Mild-Moderate': 'Cefazolin OR Oxacillin/Nafcillin OR Cephalexin',
      'Severe': 'Vancomycin OR Linezolid OR Ceftaroline'
    },
    duration: '5-7 days, tailor based on resolution of signs/symptoms',
    keyPoints: [
      'Consider MRSA coverage based on local prevalence',
      'Necrotizing fasciitis requires surgical débridement',
      'May require gram-negative/anaerobic coverage in certain scenarios'
    ],
    clinicalPearls: [
      'Elevation and immobilization aid recovery',
      'Mark borders to monitor progression',
      'Consider deeper infection if not responding to therapy'
    ]
  },
  {
    id: 'uti_pyelonephritis',
    category: 'Genitourinary',
    name: 'Pyelonephritis',
    commonPathogens: ['E. coli', 'Klebsiella species', 'Proteus species', 'Enterobacter species'],
    empiricTherapy: {
      'Treatment Options': 'Cephalexin OR TMP-SMX OR Ampicillin + Gentamicin OR Ceftriaxone OR Ciprofloxacin'
    },
    duration: '7-10 days (hospitalized), 5-10 days (outpatient), 3-5 days (simple cystitis)',
    keyPoints: [
      'Drug selection based on local antibiogram',
      'Initial short course IV therapy (2-4 days) as effective as longer courses',
      'Avoid nitrofurantoin for upper UTI or bacteremia'
    ],
    clinicalPearls: [
      'Urine culture essential for complicated UTI',
      'Consider imaging for recurrent infections',
      'Longer duration may be needed for renal abscess'
    ]
  }
];

export default medicalConditions;
